citation.article-title: Streptomyces luridiscabiei sp. nov., Streptomyces puniciscabiei sp. nov. and Streptomyces niveiscabiei sp. nov., which cause potato common scab disease in Korea
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Streptomyces puniciscabiei sp. nov.
Streptomyces puniciscabiei (pu.ni.ci.sca′bi.ei. L. adj. puniceus purple or red; L. n. scabies roughness, scabbiness; N.L. gen. n. puniciscabiei purple or red, scab-causing bacteria).
Spores are pale orange, spiny and borne in simple rectus flexuous spore-chains.
Melanin is produced on tyrosine agar, but not on peptone agar.
All ISP sugars are utilized: l-arabinose, d-fructose, d-glucose, d-mannitol, raffinose, rhamnose, sucrose, d-xylose and i-inositol.

Sensitive to 10 and 100 μg thallium acetate ml−1 and 20 μg streptomycin ml−1, but not to 5, 6 or 7 % (w/v) NaCl, 0·5 μg crystal violet ml−1, 0·1 % (w/v) phenol, 10 IU penicillin ml−1 or 25 or 100 μg oleandomycin ml−1.
Isolated from raised corky lesions on potato cv. Daeji-ma and pathogenic on potato cv. Daeji-ma.
